intro: Sonerila sulpheyi, commonly known as the Sulphey's strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats and is often found in rocky or lateritic soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces vibrant purple or red flowers that bloom during the monsoon season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
